item.title: Charlie Wilson - I Still Have You
item.description:
What good is a million
dollars and a home
Without someone to
share and give
What good is a bed
if you’re sleeping
All alone
I’m so happy
‘Cause with you
I’m never lonely
Even if it stops
snowing in winter
Never see another
white Christmas
We would go
through it together
Baby you can
count on that
If all the stars
started hiding
And we couldn’t
make a wish again
Even if the sun
stopped shining
I wouldn’t care
because
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
babe
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
yeah
I’ll be OK as long as
I still have you
What good is
a fancy car
With
nowhere to go
You’re just driving
down an empty road
One thing
for sure is
My arms was
made to hold
And these lips were
made for you
So baby kiss me
yes
Even if it stops
snowing in winter
Never see another
white Christmas
We would go
through it together
Baby you can
count on that
If all the stars
started hiding
And we couldn’t
make a wish again
Even if the sun
stopped shining
I wouldn’t care
because
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
babe
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
yeah
I’ll be OK as long as
I still have you
Things may come
and things may go
But I still have
your
Seasons change
I lose some friends
But I still have
your
When my world is
upside down
I still have
your
Said I still have you
and you got me too
Even if it stops
snowing in winter
Never see another
white Christmas
We would go
through it together
Baby you can
count on that
If all the stars
started hiding
And we couldn’t
make a wish again
Even if the sun
stopped shining
You know I wouldn’t
care because
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
babe
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
yeah
I’ll be OK as long as
I still have you
You and you have me
too babe
I still have you
babe
And you have me too
yeah
